trial_identification.studytitle: A randomised placebo-controlled trial of testosterone undecanoate in obese men as adjuvant therapy for a weight loss program
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised placebo-controlled trial of testosterone undecanoate in obese men as adjuvant therapy for a weight loss program

interventions.interventions: This is a randomised placebo-controlled trial of testosterone undecanoate in obese men with obstructive slee apena (OSA) as adjunctive therapy for a weight loss programme.The study will be conducted on an ambulatory basis and involve OSA subjects who are about to commence a standard weight reduction program. Once deemed eligible for the study, at a Screening visit, patients will report to the laboratory every 6 weeks for 18 weeks. They will receive three injections of testosterone (3000mg in total) undecanoate at 0, 6 and 12 weeks. In addition, whilst reporting patients will undergo a variety of assessments including overnight polysomnographies at weeks 0, 6 and 18 weeks. Patient will then reassessed in recovery, at one year

primaryOutcome.outcome: The primary outcome that will be measured is weight (kg) before and after treatment.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Weight will be measured at 0 and 18 weeks.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Body composition (bioimpedance, DEXA (bone densitometry), single-cut abdominal and thigh computed Tomography(CT)).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Anthropometry (waist, hip, thigh, arm, neck circumferences and skinfold thickness).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Physical activity (Physical Activity Questionnaire, motion detection)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Insulin sensitivity (by Homeostasis Model Assessment, HOMA)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Blood hormone concentrations (total and free testosterone, estradiol, sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of life /wellbeing (SF36, leading symptom scale)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Sexual function [International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Outcome varibles will be measured whilst the subjects are reporting the laboratory.
Sleep studies will be conducted at Baseline and then 7 weeks and 18 weeks after baseline.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Severe OSA ((minimum oxygen saturation < 65% or RDI > 80) requiring immediate treatment due to severity or increased associated risk (eg Transport worker), Use of drugs that alter androgen action, Contraindications to testosterone therapy, Desire for paternity within the next 12 months, Participation in sports that ban testosterone and require drug monitoring, Psychiatric disorders or drug abuse unless well controlled,Chronic medical conditions likely to interfere with or influence study treatment or safety unless well controlled.

trial_design.concealment: A researcher not directly involved in this study will be responsible for the randomisation of subjects and maintaining the blind until after the data analyses are complete.
trial_design.sequence: A computer generated randomisation list will be used.
trial_design.designfeatures: A researcher not directly involved in this study will be responsible for the randomisation of subjects and maintaining the blind. Subjects, therapists and assessors will be blinded to which group the subjects are randomised to.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: The Woolcock Institute of Medical Research

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a randomised placebo-controlled trial of testosterone undecanoate in obese men with obstructive slee apena as adjunctive therapy for a weight loss programme. The aim of the study is to evaluate the additional effect of testosterone replacement on weight loss and motivation in obese (BMI>30kg/m2) men with obstructive sleep apnea undergoing a weight reduction program. The primary endopint is weight loss after 4.5 months with other secondary endpoints including body composition, anthropometry, physical activity, metabolic markers (eg insulin sensitivity, basal metabolic rate) and blood hormone concentrations.
